description: From Middle English mencioun, mention, from Old French mention, from Latin mentiōnem, accusative of mentiō (“a mention, calling to mind”).

entries.meaning: A speaking or notice of anything, usually in a brief or cursory manner. Used especially in the phrase make mention of.
examples: I will make mention of thy righteousness.

entries.meaning: (Internet, plural only) A social media feed, a list of replies or posts mentioning a person.

verbs.description: mention (third-person singular simple present mentions, present participle mentioning, simple past and past participle mentioned)

entries.meaning: To make a short reference to something.
(philosophy, linguistics) To utter a word or expression in order to refer to the expression itself, as opposed to its usual referent.
